snippet: India lacks a tradition of graceful retirement. Just look at Sachin, its famous cricket star.
abstract: Op-Ed article by research fellow Tunku Varadarajan contends there is no Indian tradition of graceful retirement; cites aging cricket star Sachin Tendulkar, who is retiring after having continued to play even though he is a shadow of his former self; holds there is selfishness in his reluctance to give way to younger players in his pursuit of milestone, particularly for a player who built his reputation in part on unwavering modesty.
lead_paragraph: India lacks a tradition of graceful retirement. Just look at Sachin, its famous cricket star.

headline.seo: Sachin Tendulkar Finally Retires From Cricket
headline.main: Where the Gods Live On ... and On
headline.print_headline: Where the Gods Live On ... and On
